ai.summary: E2 (Humber Bridge) is a hard 17.6 km ridge hike in the UK. The route crosses exposed ridgelines with significant elevation gain, offering expansive views but demanding good fitness, navigation, and weather preparedness.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily ridge terrain with uneven, rocky paths and grass-covered sections. Expect exposed shoulders, steep ascents and descents, potential scrambling on loose material, and variable footing. Weather on ridges can change rapidly, with strong winds and reduced visibility possible.
ai.safety_notes: This route involves long miles on exposed ridges and significant elevation. Plan for daylight hours, carry maps and a compass, and do not rely solely on phone GPS. Check weather forecasts, dress in layers, and wear sturdy boots with good grip. Start early to avoid poor light; in case of injury or deteriorating conditions, have a plan to seek shelter and call for help. Stick to marked paths, be cautious near edges, and consider trekking poles for balance on uneven ground.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof shell, hat and gloves as needed)
Map and compass (and/or GPS with backup navigation)
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
First aid kit and personal medications
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (roughly March–October) for more daylight and milder conditions; winter hikes are possible with experience and proper gear.

seo.title: E2 (Humber Bridge) Ridge Hike – 17.6 km Hard Trail in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the E2 (Humber Bridge) ridge hike, a challenging 17.6 km route in the UK featuring exposed ridgelines, steep climbs, and panoramic views. Plan ahead for weather and safety.
